amendment.description: To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (Public Law 107-296) to provide that waivers of certain prohibitions on contracts with corporate expatriates shall apply only if the waiver is essential to the national security, and for other purposes.

vote.text: Amendment SA 80 as modified agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Amendment SA 80 proposed by Senator Dayton. (consideration: CR S1208, S1209-1212; text: CR S1208) To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (Public Law 107-296) to provide that waivers of certain prohibitions on contracts with corporate expatriates shall apply only if the waiver is essential to the national security, and for other purposes.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 80 as modified agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 80 proposed by Senator Dayton.
